intro: Zapoteca portoricensis subsp. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican zapoteca, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
